resources.string:
Improve your productivity and 
digital well-being

 by getting control over your phone usage
Select time when block is active in week
Enable strict blocking to prevent \nblocked apps from being unlocked
Only a reboot will disable strict blocks,\nif needed you can even disable this in the settings
Needed for blocking apps, websites, notifications, and displaying your apps usage.
Block Notification will show up here.
Create a new block by pressing the + button
Come back next Monday for your\n first app usage report.
Archive blocks will show up here.
To count and block notifications,and keep the app alive while running in the background
No data is collected from these permissions\nThis data stays on your device and only used for the app functionality.

"If this app has helped you to get more control over your phone usage, would you please consider returning a favour by giving rating on the play store?\n\nAnd if you think there is anything that can be improved please let us know by sending us an email "
Unlock all features below...\n...and support the developer of this app
MIUI pop-up window permission\nPlease give Display pop-up windows permission,this is needed in MIUI devices to block apps.
Keep foreground service alive\nEnable this if your blocks don\'t activate automatically.\n
App not working?\nIt is likely that your device stopping the app while it is running in the background.Please Press here and follow the solution for your device.
Keep blocks and limit active after device reboot\nWhen disabled, blocks and limits will only activate at their next starting time after the reboot or after opening this app.
Prevent uninstallation\nEnable device administrator to prevent the app from being uninstalled.
Pause delay\nAmount of time to wait before you can pause a block(5 seconds)
Enable PIN to open this app
Show quote at blocked app\nShow a random productivity quote when attempting to open a blocked app.
New usage report\nReceive notifications when a new usage report is ready.
"Usage limit reminders\nShow usage limit reminder notification when an app reaching its usage limit."
Blocked notifications\nWhen a block ends, show a message if there were any notification blocked.
Change language\nChange the language of the app
Hidden Usage\nApps and websites excluded from usage
"Please give Display pop-up window permission, this is needed in miui devices to block apps. "
"Permissionn for Display pop-up window has been already given, do not show this message again. "
Restriction\nConfigure rules when apps should be blocked
Add Restriction\n\nCreate a schedules, set usage limits, or leave empty to manually start the block
Enable strict mode\nyou won\'t be able to stop the block while restriction is active.
Keywords to block\nBlock any website containing the keyword in its URL
Amount of time to wait before you can pause a block
Select what information to include \nThis will only be used to help solve the issue
Send logs, device info, and app settings\n(including configured blocks and limits)
Send app usage data provided by the Android system. App IDs and website URLs get replaced with non-identifying numbers in the updated report.
Create a schedule to block this app or set an hourly or daily usage limit.

Are blocks and limits not activated automatically? It is likely that the app is being killed in the background on your device. Some device manufacturers (e.g. Huawei and Xiaomi) have modified their Android system to kill apps more aggressively, and unfortunately the app cannot prevent tis by itself. Please follow the solutions below to prevent your device from killing the app.
How can I prevent myself from uninstalling the app?
Go to the Settings within this app, and press the option to enable the Device Administrator permission to prevent the app from being uninstalled.
I\'ve lost my Premium upgrade after the app was updated, how can i restore?

This is likely due to having multiple Google accounts logged into the Play Store on your device, unfortunately there is an issue with Google Play that can cause the purchase to become invisible to the app after an update. To fix this, please try the following steps

Fix A(only works if the account used to make the purchase is the "primary" account on the device):

- Clear the data of the Google Play Store app

- Open the Google Play Store app and accept the terms

- Open this app, it should automatically detect the upgrade again. Otherwise, try Fix B below.

Fix B:

- Uninstall this app

- Open the Google Play Store and switch to the sccount you made the purchase from

- Download and open this app again

If neither works, please send me an email with your order ID (found in the receipt sent by Google when you made hte purchase)
My block is active, but I can still access my blocked apps?

First check whether you have given the right permission (there should not be a prompt on the home screen of this app asking for permission). Also check the troubleshooting steps for your device (found in the app settings), It is possible your device is killing the app in the background. In case apps are still not blocked after the permission is given, pleaswe send me an email with information about your block and which apps can still be accessed.
How do I keep blocks and limits activated after a device reboot?

You can go to the app settings and enable blocks being restarted after a reboot. Careful though, as rebooting is the only built-in option to stop any active (strict) blocks. There is no other way to stop a block onec it is active.
Why do I see the system notification \"Block is running in the background\"?

Since Android O, the system will place this notification when the app has an active service running in the background. The app needs thsi service to detect which app has been opened by you(and block if necessary), but this requires almost no work in the background. When you switch off your screen this detection will pause until you switch the screen back on agian, so overall you should not see any noticeable decrease in battery life. Unfortunately, it is not possible to turn off this notification from within the app, but there exist some apps that will hide this notification for you in the Play Store.
How do I stop an active block?

If strict mode isn\'t enabled, you can pause or edit the restrictions to diable and active block. Otherwise, in the case you really need to use an app while strict mode is enabled, you can restart your phone to stop all active blocks. If you have not disabled this in the settings. Before you do that, please remind yourself why you started the block and whether you really cannot do without that app right now.
Why can\'t I find app X to add to my block?

For emergency reasons, apps from which you can make calls have been excluded. Similarly, \"Launchers\" apps are also not supported, as they might introduce the infinite blocking messages loops. Let me know if you think your app should be able to be blocked by sending an email.
Usage per day\nTap on the bar to see your app usage on that day
Add notes to your weekly usage report

string-array.item: Instead of only last week\'s report
instead of only today\'s hourly usage graph

See number of the notifications received per app
Automatically add newly installed apps to your block
See the content of each notification
Export all app/website usage data by date as a JSON file
Start blocks in one tap using widgets

string-array.item: When reaching usage limits and for weekly usage reports
To show and block app usage
To count and block notifications,and keep the app alive while running in the background
To block websites and show website usage
To start and stop scheduled blocks
